title: "What is the Connection Between Instinct and Spiritual Vision in Ancient Priesthood Teachings?"
first_phrase: In the previous part of the text, it was explained how instinctive impulses are common to all human beings and represent their mechanical tendency to perform certain actions. In this last part, the author, Izar Bne-Exur, a pontiff from Ur, discusses the concept of the vision in the light of the spirit. According to Izar's book of perpetual conjunctions, the sun reflects everything that belongs to humans. The intelligence of the divine luminosity travels through the successive animal incarnations until it reaches the same shifted center. Izar perpetuates the idea of the chain of successive existences and reflects on the special earthly appearance of the sun in every humanization. The text explains how the moon, as a symbol of the refraction of sun rays, divides its 28 days into the four stages of existence in each zodiac sign, representing every human life.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the complex and unified idea of the chain of successive existences perpetuated by Izar, revealing the special earthly physiognomy of the sun in every animalization of the Spirit of Light and the four phases of each period in every zodiac sign, teaches us to mature, create and shape our unique human life. This knowledge is a valuable tool in preparing for our future lives and becoming initiated into the secrets of successive existences.
